S.FORM: manʉng kita! tia cu kita matiananai.
manʉng kita! soni tia ku tumatuturu Kanakanavu tamna kʉkʉnʉa.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的卡那卡那富語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I’m going to teach you how to say food in Kanakanavu.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: takituturua! ka’anʉ ku akanangʉ, maka’ʉna pa!
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: koo ku tumatimana. masitatia pa kari!
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?
請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.
請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: matarava kita nesi soni. ’apacʉ’ʉra kita rocu tarasangara!
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: sua iku ia Pani tamna manu. nganai maku ia Mu’u.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Pani, and my name is Mu’u.

S.FORM: sua iku ia Pani tamna seto. nganai maku ia Mu’u.
S.TRANSL: I am a student of Pani, my name is Mu’u.

S.FORM: sua nganai cuma maku ia Pani.
Kana’ua maku sua nguain, Pa’ʉ nganai in.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Pa’ʉ.

S.FORM: nguain tamna nganai ia Pa’ʉ kara?
ʉʉ’ʉ, nguain tamna nganai ia Pani.
nguain tamna nganai ia Pani kara?
ka’anʉ, nguain tamna nganai ia Pa’ʉ.
sua nguain ia Pi’i. iku tamna cina vuravurau sua nguain.
sua nguain ia tangria maku. ’Apu’u nganai in.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是’Apu’u。
She is my friend and her name is ’Apu’u.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
是，我是卡那卡那富族的。

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, nakai sua nguain ia Bunun.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but she is a Bunun.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, marʉngʉcai kavangvang kim cani pininga.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: ’esi cu kara marisinatʉ sua kanarua nanakʉ musu?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: tavara’ʉ kara masiKanakanavu sua kanarua musu?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?
是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: ’utumʉkʉnʉ ku mataa cuma, cina, kana’ua sarunai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
I’m from [Hualien]. *The [Hualien] is free to change to other places.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.
我是卡那卡那富族小孩。
I’m a rich kid from Kanakanavu.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ makungu, ka’anʉ macici, cucuru mamanʉng!
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: ’akia na kakangca ʉcʉ, niarapipiningi cu tamtasai.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: campe tarasangai ’ʉcanʉ, tumataniarʉ cu, niarapipiningi varanvana.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: tia mirʉngʉcʉ nusoni, atʉnʉngʉa mavici tarucung.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: nimu’ʉcanʉ kara? miseni mʉrʉpʉ kavangvang tina’an musu?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?
外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: tatia pariapara, purarupuʉn navungu musukʉmʉ cu.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: tatia taniarʉ, pariʉn navungu musukʉmʉ cu.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, tia pa kita pu’a sia’ucu’u.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: arapipiningi kita pu’a tia kʉnʉa totasiarʉ.
S.TRANSL: Shall we go out for breakfast?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ! nikʉmʉnʉ cu ku na tanasa.
S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: tia ku kumakʉnʉ tarisinata tamna mara’acʉ kʉnʉa.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: nimavici ku soni narangʉ kʉnʉa. kungangaan kita ca’ania.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go out and play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?
I’m sweeping the floor and you asked ’Avia to carry it for you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: cangkan tasinʉva isa, ukusao pa mururu!
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: kompa! koo pa ku matirupangʉ marisiki nesi.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: neni tia kamanʉngʉa musu noo aratʉkʉnʉ cu tarisinata?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: tia ku kicancan tangria arapipiningi paracani.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: neni tia makanʉnga in noo aratʉkʉnʉ cu tarisinata.

S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: ’akia nguain tanasa, ’una kara tia kari musu?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tamu, sua iku ia Paicʉ. putu’ʉnʉvoo pa!
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Paicʉ, please open the door.

S.FORM: ’Avia, sua iku ia ’Angai. tikirimi ku kasua sumasima’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: ’Avia, I’m ’Angai, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ ia! pacʉpʉngʉ kasua, cii! ivataa parʉ’ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ! makai sa’o’o cʉ’ʉrʉʉn macu’u isi.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: nipo’ucipi cu cina tia kʉnʉa rovana, ivataa cu kumakʉnʉ!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: tia cu ku aratʉkʉnʉ, maka’ʉna taniara pai cumacʉ’ʉra kasua.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: rovana cu! tia cu ku pui’i tanasa.
ʉʉ’ʉ! ivataa tanasa maku rovʉvʉ noo ’una tapaicaa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: manʉng kita! takituturua soni tia marivici kamau mukusa tanasʉn, kesoni mamarang.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: manʉng! tia kita masiKanakanavu makari mamarang.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說卡那卡那富語。
Okay! We’re going to say Kanakanavu to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.
你們會說卡那卡那富語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: manʉng kita! takituturua soni tia marivici kamua mukusa ’umo’uma vina’ʉ putukio.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: ivataa nesi matavʉnʉrʉ. atanʉngʉa mavici nonoman.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, takituturua, niavici cu mia nonoman.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: manʉng kita! soni tia kita mukusa tarʉkʉpʉa marʉkurapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: matavʉrʉnʉa kavangvang, mati’arangʉ kita pu’a kipu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: to’urua ia tapinange, kukuca ia vunai. takacicinia cumacʉ’ʉra.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: maca’ivi ucani takananga pui’i kita nesi matacuvungu.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.
我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: itaroo pa ku! mupacai cu ’acipi maku.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: tʉsʉkara nesua, moon kita nesi makananguru.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?
How does he usually go to school?
He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: makananu tamu nanakʉ musu ’inia pu’a camai?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: tinupuru kara nguain kisia mukusa Taitung?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, tupuru nguain kisia mukusa Taitung.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: tinupuru kara nguain kisia mukusa Taitung?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, tinupuru nguain hikoki mukusa Taitung.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?
有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: ’esi nanu nesi mastaan aracan tatupara cieyin?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: ’akia nesi tatupara cieyin, ’inmaamia cu tupuru haya.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: tupuru pasu tia upeni naraua makacakana tarisinata?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: tupuru kaotie tia upeni naraua makacʉkʉna Taicung?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: unting kuruma mukusa Urai, tia kara miaranau?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: tupuru kasu cieyin iavatu tanasa maku, tia upeni naraua?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: ’una kara tapaicaa musu ca’ania? tavara’ʉ kara ku rovʉvʉ kasua?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, tia ku moon tanasa maritarʉ kasua.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: ’una kara tapaicaa musu nura? pacʉpʉngʉ ku tia kesoni kasua Kanakanavu tamna ’ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於卡那卡那富族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Kanakanavu.

S.FORM: tia ku mucimʉrʉ nura, ’akia ku na tanasa.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: ’itumuru kani tavara’ʉa musu poiisua Kanakanavu tamna niurina. pacʉpʉngʉ ku tia kesoni kasua.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對卡那卡那富族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Kanakanavu, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ’itumuru tavara’ʉa maku, nakai tia ku kipatʉsʉ marivari kasua.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: kesoni pa! tia kara tavara’ʉ patara’aningu? nuari tia maraa munasʉ arisinatʉn.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.
請問您的太太也是卡那卡那富族人嗎?
我會說卡那卡那富語和布農語。
I can speak Kanakanavu and Sumukun.

S.FORM: macangcangarʉ ku soni rovʉvʉ kasua. tumatuturuan poiisua aracakanʉ tamna sipuisia.
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, miaa nanmarua pa ku, paira ku mukusa rʉmʉra aracakanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: sosomanpe kasua, cucuruana mamanʉng tinituturua musu soni.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: cucuru kavangvang sua kari maku. tiniturua tamutamua.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: nguaci kesonia soni. sosomanpe curu sinivungua musu kari.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: musurusuru cu ku, kamʉcʉ ’una pa ramangʉ rovʉvʉ kasua.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: manʉng kasu, neni tia pu’aa musu?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: manʉng kasu, neni tia pu’aa musu?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a tanuku, ’una kara nesi.
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: ’una pa nesi uturu tingasʉ. vuʉn kasua kavangvang.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: kangangaan mapusan cani vaantuku. mapusan vaantuku tʉni cu.
tia pa ku pu’a ti’ingi, pasacarapʉ na cani mʉna.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: sʉpʉroo ’ikua rima mʉna vaantuku, manʉng kara?
rangrang curu isi! tia kara tavara’ʉ yasui ti’ingi?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: matuun vaantuku sua pingkan isi. ’una pa kara cucumeni nonoman?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: tavara’ʉ kara ku sumasuruvai kasua vaantuku?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: niroimi ku mavici vaantuku, tavara’ʉ kara ku sumasuruvai kasua?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: niroimi ku mavici vaantuku, tavara’ʉ kara ku sumasuruvai kasua?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, siniruvaia musu me’inaan koo pa kasu mai’i.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: tavara’ʉ kara ku sumasuruvai kasua tikuru?
tavara’ʉ kara ku sumasuruvai sinatʉ musu?

S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: ’umu’ʉcʉnʉ cu, koo ku mavici tarucung, ’apasuruvoo ku tarucung, manʉng kara?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ucani maamia tarucung maku. cii! arakukunu kita.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: siniruvai maku me’inaan na kasua sinatʉ isi, ai’iʉn kasua.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: tia pa kara cumacʉ’ʉra cucumeni sinatʉ? tuturuo ku.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: tia ku nukanmana mai’i kasua vaantuku?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: makenanu! ai’io noo ’una cu kasu vaantuku.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?
I’ll return it to you tomorrow.
When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: siniruvai musu na ’Avia kara sua siarisinatʉ isi?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from ’Avia?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, nguain tamna cina nipu’a isi.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: ’akia cu ma’ain, mukusaa na Paicʉ sumasuruvai ma’ain.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Paicʉ.

S.FORM: ukusao na Paicʉ, mai’ia ’ikua vaantuku kisao!
S.TRANSL: Go tell Paicʉ to give me back my money.

S.FORM: sinikiam kasua upeni vaantuku sua nguain?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: tia ku mukusa tanatʉngʉa mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: ’itumuru curu cʉnʉ. ’esi ku tumatakʉtakʉ, tia pucanumu nusoni.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: uranoo ku mara kakamarʉ mataa tuku, manʉng kara?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the Big Hoe.
Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: campe ku kumakarai, tia rumarapʉ nusoni.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: tavara’ʉn cu kara apʉnʉn tanʉngʉ musu?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: tavara’ʉn cu apʉnʉn tamana nesi. ka’anʉ pa tavara’ʉn apʉnʉn namici isa.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.
哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: uranoo ku musʉ’ʉ na risakʉ, manʉng kara?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?
We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?
我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: ’anuka vavuru sua isi, iimua sua isi ia nipaicaa vavuru cacanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: pakavura kita sumasʉrʉcʉ ringai. makai ’una cu misa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: makai marisauvu cu tacau. pakavura kita kipapa ’inia.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: sua isi ia tarʉnʉ, siarupaca matisa’ʉ tongingi.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: sua iisua ia ringai, siarupaca matisa’ʉ to’urung.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: musu’ʉvʉ tamutamua marisingsing kitana, macakuarʉ niaracakana soni.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ ia! aviciʉn mita tanasʉn sovungu.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: soni tia ku tumatuturu kamua poisua marʉkurapʉ. Kanakanavu tamna kari.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的卡那卡那富語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Kanakanavu language today.

S.FORM: soni tia ku tumatuturu kamua poisua karukarua. Kanakanavu tamna kari.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的卡那卡那富語怎麼說。

S.FORM: soni tia ku tumatuturu kamua poisua macu’u. Kanakanavu tamna kari.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的卡那卡那富語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Kanakanavu language today.

S.FORM: Pani tamna tikuru kara sua isua?
ka’anʉ, Na’u tamna tikuru sua isi.

S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: tarasangai cu kita, matangiria na cacanʉ!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心！
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見！
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: manʉng kita, sua nganai maku ia Pa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Pa’ʉ.

S.FORM: manʉng kita, sua nganai maku ia ’Una.
Pa’ʉ, manʉng kasu. sua iku ia ’Akuan.
sua iku ia ’Avia tamna cina. ’Akuan sua iku.
sua iku ia ’Avia tamna kanarua. sua nganai maku ia ’Apu’u.
S.TRANSL: 我是’Avia的妹妹。我的名字是’Apu’u。
I am ’Avia’s sister. My name is ’Apu’u.

S.FORM: sua nguain ia takituturua maku. ’Upa sua nguain.
iku tamna kana’ua sarunai. Piuri sua nguain.

S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: nganai kana’ua nanakʉ maku ia Kai.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Kai.
What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: nganai kanarua nanakʉ maku ia Kini.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Kini.

S.FORM: tavara’ʉ kara kasu neni nguain tamna nganai?

S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: cenana isi maan rima cenana sua nguain.

S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: cenana isi, rima cenana sua nguain.

S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: ’esi kara kasu na tanasʉn tarisinata marisinatʉ?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, makai kim cani piunga na tarisinata.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: iku tamna cuma vuravurau sua nguain.
iku tamna kana’ua nanakʉ sua nguain.
iku tamna kanarua sarunai sua nguain.

S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: kanarua sarunai musu kara sua nguain?
ka’anʉ, sua nguain ia kanarua sarunai maku tamna tangria.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: ikasu tamna kana’ua nanakʉ kara sua nguain?
ka’anʉ, iku tamna kanarua nanakʉ sua nguain.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?
我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: cau Kanakanavu kangvang kara sua nguain?
S.TRANSL: 她也是卡那卡那富族人嗎?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, sua nguain ia cau Kanakanavu kangvang.
S.TRANSL: 是的， 她也是卡那卡那富族人。

S.FORM: makungu ti’ingi soni. karatumurua mima macici canumu.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷。要多喝熱水。

S.FORM: macici ti’ingi soni. karatumurua mima canumu.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: makai tia ’akia taniarʉ nura. ’itumuru ʉcʉ, tatia pariapara.
S.TRANSL: 明天好像沒有太陽。雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: tia makananu kakangca noo arapiningi kita taniara?
S.TRANSL: 我們出遊那天天氣如何?
How was the weather the day we go out?

S.FORM: makai tia makungu. tia matikuru pananapa.
S.TRANSL: 那天好像有點冷。出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: tia makananu kakangca noo tarasangara taniara?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: tia kara ’umu’ʉcanʉ noo arapiningi kita taniara?
S.TRANSL: 我們出遊那天會下雨嗎?
Will it be rainy the day we go out?

S.FORM: tia mangiri taniara mesua, ka’anʉ tia ’umu’ʉcanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: tia kara ’umu’ʉcanʉ noo arapiningi kita taniara?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ’umu’ʉcanʉ masini. tia ’umu’ʉcanʉ noo ca’ania. marivicia tarucung.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨。中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, tia makungu kana’amisan nuaceni. tia ’itumuru patikurua.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷。要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: tia kara macici kana’ʉcana cenana isi?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, macici kana’ʉcana, tia karatumuru mima canumu.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.
我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.
我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: mu’uru’urua kasu, tikirimi ku kasua nusoni.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ pa, ’esi pa ku marisinau takupin.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: tarasangai marisinatʉ, neni tia kamanʉngʉa musu?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: tarasangai marisinatʉ, neni tia kamanʉngʉa in?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: ’akia tanasa Pi’i. sua iku ia Kai, ’una kara tia kari? tuturuʉn nakui Pi’i.
S.TRANSL: Pi’i不在家耶!我是Kai，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Pi’i。
Pi’i is not at home. I am Kai. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: tamu, sua ikim ia Kini mataa Pi’i. uaranao kim putu’ʉnʉvʉ.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Kini和Pi’i，幫我們開門。
Grandma, we are Kini and Pi’i, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: sua iku ia Pori, tia ku tikirimi Pa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: I am Pori, I am here for Pa’ʉ.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: miaranau cu kasu koo iavatu. pacʉpʉngʉ ku kasua.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Pi’i, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: cii! musikaraa! miaranau cu ku maritarʉ kasua.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: nimʉkʉa maku sua tammi isi. kutanamaan!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: ivataa! nimʉkʉa maku sua macu’u isi, kutanamaan!
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看！
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: tupurua, sua isi ia, nimʉkʉa maku yo-ci viaru, kutanamaan!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ku tʉni kumakʉnʉ vʉ’ʉ, kumakʉnʉ kui rinko.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
嗚! 真的很香也好吃！
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.
我吃了好多，不能再吃了！
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: takituturua soni tia marivici kamua mucimʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.
媽媽說山上有很多蚊子
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: takituturua soni tia marivici kamua mukusa ’umo’uma.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: tia marivici kitana takituturua mukusa cikiringa cakʉran.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: tia kara kita mukusa cikiringa cakʉran soni?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, tia marivici kitana takituturua mucimʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: takituturua, mukusa kita cikiringa cakʉran, neni tia cʉ’ʉraa?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: takituturua, mukusa kita cimʉrʉ. neni tia cʉ’ʉraa?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: tia kita mukusa ’umo’uma cumacʉ’ʉra nimʉkʉa mita viaru. tia matangiri ’una takʉrʉma, anu.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: takituturua, tia kara kita mukusa cʉkʉran makananguru?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, tia kita mukusa ’inia cumacʉ’ʉra tamcurunga.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: takituturua, tia kara kita mukusa ’umo’uma mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: campe ku soni cumacʉ’ʉra ’esi pa murungisaa tamcurunga.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: iei! uaa! manmaan ku ta’anna, maningcau.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ta’anna isua, anu sua isua!
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.
不要用跑的！慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Paicʉ go to school?
Paicʉ goes to school by train.
How does Pani go to church?
Pani goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: tupara kara kasu kao-tie mukusa Kao-siung?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, tupara ku kao-tie mukusa Kaosiung.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: mukusa kasu Taitung, tukisia kara? nukai tuhikoki?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: tuhikoki ku, mara’an tuhikoki sua na kisia.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: mukusa kasu kiukai, tupasu kara? nukai ’unting kuruma?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: ’unting ku kuruma mukusa kiukai, maraa munasʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: aracan kara tanasa mu sua tamia’aa cau-sʉ?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ aracan, tu’utupai ku mukusa tamia’aa cau-sʉ.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: aracan kara tarisinata mu sua yu-ci?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: aranai tatuparaa kisia. rima vungu makacʉkʉna cu.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ’una ku putukioa soni, ’akia tanasa, cucumeni taniara kʉcʉ!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧！
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: ’una kara tapaicaa musu nura? tikirimi ku kasua noca’ania.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: tʉni, maritarʉ ku kasua na tanasa.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: tia kara ku tʉni mapusikarʉ kari? tia maku arisinatʉn.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ku manʉngcau, mataa marapusu riung, aka cukui.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: neni putukioa musu miaa nanmarua pa?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kesacu ku miana, nakai tarasangai cu masini.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: kesoni kasua, manu musu ’esi kara na tanasʉn?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ’akia, monoon na tumʉra sua manu maku.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: ’apacʉvʉrʉ pa ku ucani tacau mataa ucani tapinange. cani pininga maku sua nguani.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥。他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: ’una pa ku ucani ngiau. arakukunu marʉkurapʉ ka’anʉ miarara.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓。有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: tia ku kesoni kasua poisua aracakanʉ tamna puisia.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ka’anʉ ’itumuru tavara’ʉa maku, tia ku marivari sua tavara’ʉa maku.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.
你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: siarupaca aracakanʉ tamna nakʉvʉ, puisia nanakʉ matu’usu.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Pa’ʉ, ’akia cu tanasa pa’ici, arapipiningia kasu pu’a.
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Pa’ʉ, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ’una pa na tapo’ucipia cani pania, namune’i cukui pu’a!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: ka’anʉ musutampʉ cani pania, pu’aa pa urucin pania.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a pa’ici, ’una kara kamu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a urucin pania, tia pa pu’a cani pucua vʉra.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: ’esi nesi vʉra, ’una pa kara cucumeni tia araa?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?
I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a mangtʉ’ai sipi’i tikuru.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Piuri, vimukusa kasu nanu misoni? ’esi kara ’untu?
S.TRANSL: Piuri你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Piuri, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, ’esi ku muranʉ tamu mapu’a tavoo.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: makasiava, ’una kara tapaicaa musu rovana? kungangaan kita kumakʉnʉ uru.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: aka, tia ku arapiningi pu’a tikuru.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: manʉng kasu. upeni vantuku natʉngʉ isi?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: vuo ku cusa cota natʉngʉ mataa cani cingcing tammi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Pa’ʉ, niroimi ku marivici siarisinatʉ, tʉni kara kasu ’apasuruvai ’ikua?
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Pa’ʉ, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ’akia ku kangvang. Paicʉ tamna sua isi.
tʉni kara ’apasuruvai ’ikua ’arivatʉ? tia makacang mai’i kasua.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Paicʉ for me.

S.FORM: tia pa ku mai’i urucin sinatʉ isi.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: tia pa ku sumasuruvai uturu sinatʉ isi.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: tʉni cu! atʉnʉngʉa maca’ivi turu taniara tia mai’i.
S.TRANSL: 好了！記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了？
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: nguai kara nipasuruvai musu na Pa’ʉ?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Pa’ʉ?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Paicʉ, pananapa isi, Pa’ʉ kara ’apasuruvai kasua?
S.TRANSL: Paicʉ, did Pa’ʉ lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, isi ia cina maku nipu’a movua ’ikua.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Pa’ʉ tamna pananapa matʉa mataa kasua.
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: ta’ʉrʉm sua nguain tamna pananapa. ka’aʉ matʉa tapasʉ mia.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的。我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Paicʉ, siniruvai kara kasu na Pa’ʉ vantuku?
S.TRANSL: Paicʉ, did you borrow money from Pa’ʉ?

S.FORM: ’aveni, natia ku soni mai’i ’inia, niroimi ku marivici vantuku.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, muranʉ ku kasua tumatuturu Pa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Pa’ʉ for you.

S.FORM: sua tongingi ia, tia ’uaupacaʉn tarʉnʉ matisa’ʉ. sua tivukarʉ ia, tia ’uaupacaʉn cipi matisa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓。⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: makasiava! muriva’ʉ ku, imuava koo pa ku matisa’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣！我都搞錯了，難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: tumatuturu ku kasua makananu kamanʉngʉ urucin ringai isi.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ia’a manʉngana! tʉni cu ku matisa’ʉ marʉkurapʉ no’unaan.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: macasʉ cu na ’umo’uma cʉnʉ. mukusaa na ruing mara kakamarʉ, tia kita mukusa ’umo’uma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了。你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ’esi na ciciri karara. musikara riung tʉni cu cʉ’ʉrʉʉn.
S.TRANSL: 在穀物乾燥簍的旁邊。你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.
小心拿！不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: ’esi na rocu karu isa ringai maku.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: nikamanʉngʉ ku nesi cukanang. tavara’ʉ ku ’esi nanu ringai maku.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號。我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: sua isi ia kasa, tia usʉ’ʉn na nungnung parivutukuru.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.
我們那邊沒有魚筌。我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: koo pa ku ’urupaca piacapa. maka’ʉna tʉni kara kasu tumatuturu ’ikua?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿。你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?
好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: makasuin, maka’ʉna tumatuturu ku kasua kamanʉngʉ kasa.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: mavʉrʉvʉrʉ cu piacapa musu, makai ’una cu rumara’isi, arisʉ’ʉrʉo cu!
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了，你快拉起來！
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: kompa! mavʉrʉvʉrʉ curu ’avangʉ. moon ku nesi marisi’ʉrʉ, mukusaa nesa kasu mara sapuarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 等等！船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: arisʉ’ʉrʉo vutukuru na ’ikua. muranʉ ku kasua marisʉ’ʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: cucuruana mamanʉng! macakuarʉ soni. kuratumuru cu karara.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收。魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: pui’i cu kita sovungu na cau.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了!快坐在座位上!
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: soni ia Tarasangara Rima, tarasangai nura, arakukunu kita arapipiningi sumasima’ʉ!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ manʉng! mukusa kita cikiringa cakʉran.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: nura ia Tarasangara Tutu, ca’ania nura arapipiningi kita kamamari!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: neni tia kamanʉngʉa musu totasiarʉ nura?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: nura ia Tarasangara Taniara, tia ku maracocua cina mukusa kiukai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: tia ku taraparuparu, tia ku mukusa tota’ia.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: takituturu, musukʉmʉ vʉcʉkʉ maku, tia ku mukusa tota’ia.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: tia cu tarasangai kiaturu, mucana nusoni.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: takituturua, musukʉmʉ navungu maku, tia ku tuki tarasangai.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: takituturua, rocu Tarasangara Cani tia ku tuki tarasangai, tia ku ’apacʉ’ʉra ’iseeng.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.
She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: takituturua, musukʉmʉ Pani tamna ’ʉmʉca, tuki tarasangai soni.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Pani has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: sua nganai maku ia Pa’ʉ, maan cenana masini.
S.TRANSL: My name is Pa’ʉ, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: sua ikasu ia neni cuku tamna manu?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: sua iku ia Kanakanavu tamna manu.
S.TRANSL: 我是卡那卡那富族小孩。

S.FORM: cani pininga musu ia Cau Vuvurung kara kavangvang?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, cani pininga maku ia Cau Vuvurung kavangvang.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是原住民。
Yes, my whole family is Kanakanavu.

S.FORM: cani pininga musu ia Cau Vuvurung kara kavangvang?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, sua cuma maku ia Kanakanavu, sua cina maku ia Pakisia.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是卡那卡那富族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Kanakanavu, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: sua iku ia Mu’u tamna manu.
cuma musu kara sua isa? upeni cenana sua nguain?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: cuma musu kara sua isa? upeni cenana sua nguain?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, sua nguain ia tanasʉn mia tamna marangʉ, maruun cu cenana.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: maan aru cenana kana’ua sarunai maku.
cenana kana’ua sarunai musu tatia kasua upeni?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: miaranau cu koo ’arupacʉ’ʉra, niaracʉvʉrʉ kara kasu?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: tia ku mukusa ’aravang pan-kung tikirimi takituturua.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ’esi na tanangurua sua nguain, nusoni tia arumuanʉ makananguru.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ’esi nanu sua Pi’i? nusoni tia arumuanʉ arapana’ʉ sua nguain.
S.TRANSL: Pi’i在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Pi’i? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ’esi na ’aravang sikaisisi sua nguain, ukusʉʉn maku pokari.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: tia pa ku mata’uru pu’a tia kʉnʉa ca’ania, tikirimi ku kasua nusoni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: tikirimia cau cucumeni, tia ku tikirimi takituturua.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: soni tia kara arumuanʉ tungtung mari sua Pani?
S.TRANSL: Is Pani competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: taniara ’untukai mesua tia kara kasu matipa arumuanʉ?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: taniara ’untukai mesua tia kara kasu matipa arumuanʉ?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: taniara ’untukai mesua neni tia kamanʉngʉa mita?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: tia kara kita mapu’a kʉkʉnʉa noo ’untukai?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, tia kita mapu’a mari nipurarupua.

S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ’akia, campe arapiningi, tia cu rovana pui’i.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.
他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Paniava, miaranau cu koo cumacʉ’ʉra kasua, manʉng pa kara?
S.TRANSL: 是Pani阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Pani. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: ’esi na tapo’ucipia mangʉrʉ camai, pokariʉn maku.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: ’akia na tanasa tamu mu, ’esi ’uma, mon na tanasa maritarʉ ’inia pui’i.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: miaranau cu koo ’arupacʉ’ʉra, marʉngʉcai cu kasu.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: tia vua kasua sua pangtan isi, tia usʉ’ʉn na satu’u ʉrʉna.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: miaranau cu koo iavatu, pokariʉn maku kavangvang kungangaan.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: namune’i cukui! mima ku mamia rangina, mu’aravang kita parʉ’ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: sosomanpe kasua ’apatupuru, tia cu ku pui’i.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: campe pipacaiʉn tarukuka isi, arivicio ’apu’iarʉ kumʉnʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: ’arupacʉ’ʉra kita ca’ania nura, tia kara manʉng?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: tia kara manʉng na tarisinata? tia kim mapusikarʉ ’aningu.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: mukusa kʉcʉ na Cakʉrʉ, matikuru ku Kanakanavu.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: noo tumavungavung sakura puraku mia manʉngʉcau, maritarʉ noo tumavungauvng cu ia, iavataa kasu tikirimi ’ikua.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: makasuin tia maritarʉ na kana’iara, tia kara rovana curu!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你米貢祭的時候來吧!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kesoni kasua, neni vanai tia aravari na puraku cumacʉvʉrʉ.
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: meseni ka’anʉ na namanamarʉ tumatuturu sinatʉ?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: vanai sii pacvʉpʉngʉ ku tanasʉn, pacʉpʉngʉ tia paso’e na puraku.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: saihu kasu tumata’isi, neni tumatuturu kasua?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: tamu nanakʉ maku, sua nguain ia, puraku mia mastaan saihu tumata’isi.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: miseni kasu pacʉpʉngʉ tia kiatuturu tumata’isi?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: mungka mia sua tumata’isi, pacʉpʉngʉ ku tia ’apacuvungu mungka isi.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: sauhuana kasu, tia kara miaranau kamanʉngʉn?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ka’anʉ, manasʉ cani tarasangara tʉni cu. tia pata’uruʉn parai mataa vʉra pociriʉn, tia pa usʉ’ʉn ti’ingi tamu pa’ici, ’apusikarʉn cu na pungana.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: ’una ku nesi manman mataa cʉngaa, tinakacicini maku mumʉkʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: manmaan ku tikuru isi, upeni vantuku?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: rangrang curu! tʉni kara iasui ti’ingi?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: aka, tia ku sungsuru noo iasui curu.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ kʉcʉ! tia ku pu’a ucani ta’ʉrʉm tikuru.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a numanʉ mataa ’uia isi.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: kangangaan 2000 vantuku, iku tinakacicini ’ururamucu kamanʉngʉ, hakiri tia miaranau ’urupacʉʉn.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: siukai ku tangria iavatu pu’a, tʉni pa kara iasui ti’ingi?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.
來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.
One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tia ku pu’a ucani, vuo ’ikua vo’orua.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: manʉng kasu, tia ku pu’a tipi mataa tasini ’aramʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: vangvangʉʉn cu mapu’a, ’una pa cung-yu-ping, tia kara kasu pu’a?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ kʉcʉ, pu’a ku ucani, maka’ʉna tia ku pu’a uru.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ʉʉ’ʉ, ’apusikarʉn maku na sarai, makasia 50 vantuku.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
